entries.meaning: A more solid, dense or hard layer on a surface or boundary.
The external, hardened layer of certain foodstuffs, including most types of bread, fried meat, etc.
An outer layer composed of pastry
The bread-like base of a pizza.
(Britain, Australia, New Zealand, Ireland, Canada) The top or bottom slice of a loaf of bread; The end piece of a loaf; The heel.
(geology) The outermost layer of the lithosphere of the Earth.
(astronomy, by extension) The outermost layer of any terrestrial planet.
The shell of crabs, lobsters, etc.

examples: You've got a lot of crust standing there saying that.

entries.meaning: (music) Ellipsis of crust punk (a subgenre of punk music)

verbs.description: crust (third-person singular simple present crusts, present participle crusting, simple past and past participle crusted)

examples: The whole body is crusted over with ice.
